document_type: Licence Conditions and Codes of Practice (LCCP) - Code of Practice Provisions

document_overview.purpose: Sets out codes of practice and best practice guidance for gambling operators licensed by the UK Gambling Commission
document_overview.structure: Guidance provisions organized in sections covering cooperation, financial requirements, and protection of vulnerable persons
document_overview.compliance_obligation: Varies by provision type - mandatory conditions (SR Code), guidance (Ordinary Code), or standard practice
document_overview.enforcement: SR Code breach = license review, suspension, revocation, or financial penalties. Ordinary Code breach may be considered in license review but cannot result in financial penalties

provision_types.breach_consequence: Breach may lead to: licence review with view to suspension/revocation, imposition of financial penalty, criminal prosecution, consideration of suitability to be licensee
provision_types.enforcement_discretion: Commission exercises full discretion in enforcement

provision_types.compliance_status: Best practice guidance - not a condition of licence
provision_types.alternative_approach: Operators may adopt alternative approaches if they: (a) actively take account of the provision, and (b) demonstrate alternative is reasonable in their circumstances OR equally effective
provision_types.breach_consequence: Breach does NOT lead to financial penalty. May be considered by Commission in licence review and admitted as evidence in court proceedings
provision_types.admissibility: Admissible in civil and criminal proceedings; must be considered relevant by courts and Commission

sections.section_overview: Cooperation with Commission and responsibility for third parties

subsections.subsection_title: Cooperation and responsibility for third parties

applies_to: All licences
provisions.provision_summary: Licensees must conduct gambling operations without putting licensing objectives at risk, work openly with Commission, and disclose material information

key_requirements.requirement: Conduct operations to protect licensing objectives
key_requirements.detail: Licensees must conduct gambling operations in a way that does not put the licensing objectives at risk
key_requirements.compliance_action: Implement policies ensuring compliance with all three licensing objectives: consumer protection, crime prevention, young persons protection

key_requirements.requirement: Open and cooperative engagement with Commission
key_requirements.detail: Work with Commission in open and cooperative manner
key_requirements.compliance_action: Respond promptly to Commission requests; proactively disclose relevant information

key_requirements.detail: Disclose anything Commission would reasonably need to be aware of in exercising its regulatory functions, including anything likely to have material impact on licensee's business or ability to conduct activities compliantly
key_requirements.compliance_action: Establish procedures for identifying and escalating material issues to Commission

provisions.guidance_note: This principle applies to compliance with all licence conditions and codes of practice provisions

provisions.provision_title: Responsibility for third parties - all licences
applies_to: All licences
provisions.provision_summary: Licensees are responsible for actions of contracted third parties and must ensure contractual terms protect licensing objectives

key_requirements.requirement: Licensee responsibility for third party actions
key_requirements.detail: Licensees are responsible for the actions of third parties with whom they contract for provision of any aspect of licensed activities
key_requirements.compliance_action: Conduct due diligence on all third party suppliers; maintain oversight

key_requirements.requirement: Contractual terms must require third parties to comply

subsections.detail: Require third party to conduct themselves as if bound by same licence conditions and subject to same codes of practice as licensee
Oblige third party to provide information reasonably required by licensee to enable compliance with information reporting and regulatory obligations to Commission

Enable licensee, subject to dispute resolution provisions, to terminate third party's contract promptly if: (i) third party in breach of contract, or (ii) third party acted inconsistently with licensing objectives, including breach of advertising code of practice by affiliates

applies_to: All remote licences
provisions.provision_summary: Remote licensees must ensure user interface third parties comply with technical standards and enable contract termination

key_requirements.detail: Remote licensees must ensure third parties providing user interfaces enabling customer access comply with Commission technical standards for remote gambling systems
key_requirements.compliance_action: Include term requiring RTS compliance in contracts; verify through testing

key_requirements.detail: Enable termination of user interface provider's contract if in breach of technical standards term
key_requirements.compliance_action: Include termination right in contracts; monitor compliance

applies_to: All remote and non-remote casino licences
provisions.provision_summary: Licensees should follow Commission guidance on AML/CFT for casinos

key_requirements.detail: Act in accordance with Commission's guidance on anti-money laundering: 'The Prevention of Money Laundering and Combating the Financing of Terrorism - Guidance for remote and non-remote casinos'
key_requirements.compliance_action: Review and implement Commission AML/CFT guidance; maintain procedures documentation

provisions.referenced_guidance: Commission publication: 'The Prevention of Money Laundering and Combating the Financing of Terrorism - Guidance for remote and non-remote casinos'

applies_to: All licences except casino licences
provisions.provision_summary: Non-casino operators should follow Commission advice on PoCA 2002 and TA 2000 compliance

key_requirements.requirement: Comply with PoCA 2002 and TA 2000 procedures
key_requirements.detail: As part of procedures for compliance with requirements in Proceeds of Crime Act 2002 and Terrorism Act 2000, take into account Commission's advice
key_requirements.compliance_action: Review and implement Commission guidance on PoCA 2002 compliance; establish reporting procedures

provisions.referenced_guidance: Commission publication: 'Duties and responsibilities under the Proceeds of Crime Act 2002 – Advice for operators (excluding casino operators)'

sections.section_title: Protection of Children and Other Vulnerable Persons
sections.section_overview: Requirements for combating problem gambling, preventing underage access, and customer protection

applies_to: All licences
provisions.provision_summary: Licensees must have and implement policies and procedures promoting socially responsible gambling

key_requirements.requirement: Establish SR gambling policies and procedures
key_requirements.detail: Licensees must have and put into effect policies and procedures intended to promote socially responsible gambling including all specific policies required by provisions in section 3 of this code
key_requirements.compliance_action: Document comprehensive SR policies covering all section 3 requirements; implement with staff training

provisions.enforcement_consequence: Breach of SR Code = Commission may review licence with view to suspension/revocation or impose financial penalty

subsections.subsection_title: Access to gambling by children and young persons

provisions.provision_title: Casinos SR code - Preventing underage gambling
applies_to: All non-remote casino licences
provisions.provision_summary: Casinos must prevent underage gambling through policies, designated supervisors, and staff training

key_requirements.requirement: Policies and procedures for age verification
key_requirements.detail: Must have and put into effect policies and procedures designed to prevent underage gambling, and monitor the effectiveness of these

key_requirements.requirement: Account for premises structure and layout
key_requirements.detail: Policies and procedures must take account of structure and layout of gambling premises
Must designate one or more supervisors for each casino entrance
Supervisor's responsibilities include ensuring compliance with this section of code

subsections.detail: Check age of customers who appear to be or are suspected of being underage
Refuse entry to anyone unable to produce acceptable form of identification (containing photograph, date of birth, valid, legible, no signs of tampering)
Take action on unlawful attempts to enter premises, including removing anyone who appears underage without acceptable ID

key_requirements.detail: Must not deliberately provide facilities for gambling in way that appeals particularly to children or young people, for example by reflecting or being associated with youth culture
In premises restricted to adults, service must be refused where any adult is accompanied by child or young person

key_requirements.requirement: Staff training on underage gambling prevention
key_requirements.detail: Must take all reasonable steps to ensure all staff understand responsibilities for preventing underage gambling, including appropriate training covering relevant prohibitions and legal requirements on returning stakes and not paying prizes to underage customers

Must conduct test purchasing or take part in collective test purchasing programmes to provide reasonable assurance of effective underage prevention policies and procedures; must provide test purchase results to Commission in specified form

provisions.provision_title: Casinos ordinary code - Age verification best practice
applies_to: All non-remote casino licences
provisions.provision_summary: Best practice guidance for casino age verification and supervision

key_requirements.detail: Sufficient number of supervisors to enable considered judgement about everyone's age and appropriate action whilst not allowing unsupervised entry; cannot be accomplished solely through CCTV - requires physical presence; heavily used entrances may require more than one supervisor
Supervisors may be assisted by door keepers, but supervisor retains responsibility for compliance and must personally deal with any doubt or dispute about eligibility
Commission considers acceptable: PASS logo identification (Citizencard, Validate), military ID, driving licence (including provisional) with photocard, passport
Staff should check age of any customer appearing to be under 25
Consider permanent exclusion of any adult accompanied by child/young person on more than one occasion to adult-only premises, or if evidence suggests knowing or reckless offence

Procedures for dealing with cases where child/young person repeatedly attempts to gamble on adult premises, including oral warnings, reporting to Commission and police, and making available problem gambling information
Staff training should include, at minimum, policies for induction training and refresher training

provisions.provision_title: Adult Gaming Centres SR code - Preventing underage gambling
applies_to: All adult gaming centre licences
provisions.provision_summary: AGCs must prevent underage gambling through age checking, premises monitoring, and staff training

key_requirements.requirement: Policies and procedures for age verification
key_requirements.detail: Must have and put into effect policies and procedures designed to prevent underage gambling, and monitor the effectiveness of these

subsections.detail: Check age of apparently underage customers
Remove anyone appearing underage without acceptable identification
Take action when under-18s attempt to enter

key_requirements.detail: Policies and procedures must take account of structure and layout of gambling premises
Must not deliberately provide facilities in way appealing particularly to children or young people
In premises restricted to adults, service must be refused where any adult is accompanied by child or young person
Take all reasonable steps to ensure all staff understand responsibilities for preventing underage gambling, including appropriate training

subsections.detail: Contains photograph from which individual can be identified
States individual's date of birth
Is valid
Is legible and has no visible signs of tampering or reproduction

key_requirements.detail: All licensees must conduct test purchasing or take part in collective test purchasing programmes; provide results to Commission in specified form

provisions.provision_title: Remote SR code - Preventing underage gambling
applies_to: All remote licences except lottery, gaming machine technical, gambling software, host, ancillary remote bingo, ancillary remote casino
provisions.provision_summary: Remote operators must prevent underage gambling through age verification before funds/access, staff training, and filtering software

key_requirements.requirement: Policies and procedures for age verification
key_requirements.detail: Must have and put into effect policies and procedures designed to prevent underage gambling and monitor the effectiveness of these

subsections.detail: Verify age of customer BEFORE customer is able to: (i) deposit any funds into account, (ii) access any free-to-play versions of gambling games, or (iii) gamble using own money or free bet/bonus
Warn potential customers that underage gambling is an offence
Regularly review age verification systems and implement all reasonable improvements as technology advances and information improves
Ensure relevant staff properly trained in age verification procedures, particularly customer services staff on secondary identification when initial verification fails
Enable gambling websites to permit filtering software (e.g. parental controls in schools) to restrict access to relevant site pages

subsections.subsection_title: Gambling management tools and responsible gambling information

applies_to: All licences except gaming machine technical, gambling software, host, ancillary remote bingo, ancillary remote casino, remote betting (remote platform)
provisions.provision_summary: Licensees must make responsible gambling information readily available to all customers

key_requirements.detail: Must make information readily available to customers on how to gamble responsibly and how to access information about and help for problem gambling

subsections.detail: Any measures provided by licensee to monitor or control gambling (e.g. restricting session duration or spending)
Timers or reminders or 'reality checks' where available
Self-exclusion options
Information about availability of further help or advice

key_requirements.detail: Information must be directed to all customers whether or not licensee also makes available material specifically directed at problem gamblers

For gambling premises: information must be available in all areas where gambling facilities provided and adjacent to ATMs, displayed prominently using methods appropriate to premises size/layout, may include posters/product information/screens/other facilities, must be available in form that may be taken away, may be made available through online links or smart technology, licensee must take all reasonable steps to ensure accessible discreetly

applies_to: All remote licences except lottery (non-instant win), gaming machine technical, gambling software, host, ancillary remote bingo, ancillary remote casino, ancillary remote betting, remote betting intermediary (trading rooms), remote general betting (limited)
provisions.provision_summary: Remote operators must implement effective customer interaction systems to identify and act on harm indicators with appropriate and timely interventions

key_requirements.detail: Implement effective customer interaction systems and processes minimizing risk of customers experiencing gambling harms; must embed three elements: identify, act, evaluate, and reflect that CI is ongoing process per Commission guidance
Take into account Commission's guidance on customer interaction for remote operators as published and revised from time to time

Consider factors making customers more vulnerable to gambling harms; implement systems and processes to take appropriate and timely action when vulnerability indicators identified, taking account of Commission's approach to vulnerability

key_requirements.requirement: Monitor customer activity from account opening
key_requirements.detail: Have in place effective systems and processes to monitor customer activity from point when account is opened to identify harm or potential harm

Use range of indicators relevant to customer and gambling facilities to identify harm. Must include: (a) customer spend, (b) patterns of spend, (c) time spent gambling, (d) gambling behaviour indicators, (e) customer-led contact, (f) use of gambling management tools, (g) account indicators
key_requirements.compliance_action: Implement monitoring systems capturing all indicator types; configure automated alerts

key_requirements.detail: If contracting with third party B2B providers for any aspect of licensed activities, licensee is responsible for ensuring systems and processes are in place to monitor customer activity for each indicator in paragraph 5(a-g) in timely way
Systems and processes for customer interaction must flag indicators of risk of harm in timely manner for manual intervention and feed into automated processes
Take appropriate action in timely manner when identified risk of harm

key_requirements.requirement: Tailored action based on harm level
key_requirements.detail: Tailor type of action based on number and level of indicators of harm, including: (a) tailored action at lower levels seeking to minimize future harm, (b) increasing action where earlier stages not effective, (c) strong/stronger action as immediate next step where appropriate rather than increasing gradually, (d) reducing/preventing marketing or bonus take-up where appropriate, (e) ending business relationship where necessary

key_requirements.requirement: Prevent marketing where strong harm indicators present
key_requirements.detail: Prevent marketing and take up of new bonus offers where strong indicators of harm (as defined within licensee's processes) have been identified

key_requirements.requirement: Automated processes for strong harm indicators
key_requirements.detail: Ensure strong indicators of harm are acted on in timely manner by implementing automated processes; where applied, must manually review operation in each individual customer case and allow customer opportunity to contest automated decision
Implement processes to understand impact of individual interactions and actions on customer behaviour, continued risk of harm, and whether further action needed
Take all reasonable steps to evaluate effectiveness of overall approach, for example by trialling and measuring impact, and be able to demonstrate to Commission the outcomes

key_requirements.requirement: Align with published problem gambling rates
key_requirements.detail: Take account of problem gambling rates for relevant gambling activity as published by Commission to check whether number of customer interactions is at minimum in line with this level

applies_to: All remote licences except lottery (non-instant win), gaming machine technical, gambling software, host, ancillary remote bingo, ancillary remote casino, ancillary remote betting, remote betting intermediary (trading rooms), remote general betting (limited)
provisions.provision_summary: Remote operators must undertake financial vulnerability checks for customers exceeding spending thresholds and take proportionate action

key_requirements.detail: Undertake financial vulnerability check for customers that meet the relevant threshold

Financial vulnerability check must include customer-specific public record information check for significant indicators of potential financial vulnerability, including whether customer is subject to: (a) bankruptcy order or equivalent, or (b) county court judgment, individual voluntary arrangement, high court judgment, administration order, decree, Debt Relief Order, or equivalent

key_requirements.requirement: Assess and act on financial vulnerability

subsections.detail: Consider financial vulnerability information obtained together with all other customer information permitted to use to assess risk
Take proportionate action when risk identified
Record rationale for decision on proportionate action

key_requirements.detail: Have and put into effect policies and procedures on: (a) whether it appropriate for decision on proportionate action to be manual, fully automated (with customer opportunity for manual review), or combination, (b) circumstances in which immediate action necessary to limit harm where significant risk identified
Not required to conduct check at relevant threshold if previously conducted check or financial risk assessment within previous 12 months
Where customer's deposits minus withdrawals exceeds £150 in rolling 30-day period
Where customer's deposits minus withdrawals exceeds £500 in rolling 30-day period

provisions.provision_title: Self-exclusion - Non-remote and trading rooms SR code
applies_to: All non-remote licences (except lottery, gaming machine technical, gambling software) and remote betting intermediary (trading rooms only)
provisions.provision_summary: Non-remote operators must establish self-exclusion procedures, prevent marketing to excluded individuals, and remove from marketing databases

key_requirements.detail: Have and put into effect procedures for self-exclusion and take all reasonable steps to refuse service or prevent individual who has entered self-exclusion agreement from participating in gambling
As soon as practicable, take all reasonable steps to prevent any marketing material being sent to self-excluded customer

Take steps to remove name and details of self-excluded individual from any marketing databases used by company or group (or otherwise flag) within two days of receiving completed self-exclusion notification

Covers any marketing material relating to gambling or other activities on premises where gambling may take place; does not extend to blanket geographical marketing where excluded individual not knowingly included

Close any customer accounts of individual who has entered self-exclusion agreement and return any funds held in account; not sufficient merely to prevent withdrawal whilst still accepting wagers; where credit is permitted, may retain details of amount owed but account must not be active

Put into effect procedures designed to ensure self-excluded individual cannot gain access to gambling, including: (a) register of excluded with appropriate records, (b) photo identification (except where alternative means at least as effective), (c) staff training for effective administration, (d) removal of persons found gambling or attempting to gamble
Ensure procedures take account of structure and layout of gambling premises
When administering self-exclusion agreement, signpost individual to counselling and support services

applies_to: All remote licences except gaming machine technical, gambling software, host, ancillary remote bingo, ancillary remote casino, betting intermediary (trading room), remote betting (standard) (remote platform)
provisions.provision_summary: Remote operators must establish self-exclusion procedures, prevent marketing, close accounts, and allow self-exclusion via customer services and automated process

key_requirements.detail: Have and put into effect procedures for self-exclusion and take all reasonable steps to refuse service or prevent individual from participating in gambling
As soon as practicable, take all reasonable steps to prevent any marketing material being sent to self-excluded customer
Take steps to remove name and details from any marketing databases (or otherwise flag) within two days of receiving completed self-exclusion notification
Covers any marketing material relating to gambling; does not extend to blanket geographical marketing where excluded individual not knowingly included

Close any customer accounts of individual who has entered self-exclusion agreement and return any funds held in account; where credit permitted, may retain details of amount owed but account must not be active

Put into effect procedures to ensure self-excluded individual cannot gain access to gambling, including: (a) register of excluded with appropriate records, (b) record of card numbers to be excluded, (c) staff training, (d) removal of access from persons found to have gambled or attempted to gamble
When administering self-exclusion, signpost individual to counselling and support services

Customers given opportunity to self-exclude by: (a) contacting customer services, (b) entering automated process via remote communication; acceptable to include additional confirmation step to avoid inadvertent exclusion; ensure all customer service staff aware of self-exclusion system and able to direct to immediate contact point

applies_to: All remote licences except lottery (non-instant win), ancillary remote betting (certain circumstances), remote general betting (remote platform), remote betting intermediary (trading room), gaming machine technical, gambling software, host, ancillary remote bingo, ancillary remote casino
provisions.provision_summary: Remote operators must participate in national multi-operator self-exclusion scheme

key_requirements.detail: Licensees must participate in the national multi-operator self-exclusion scheme

applies_to: All non-remote casino, bingo, betting licences (except track premises betting) and gaming machine general operating licences for adult gaming centres
provisions.provision_summary: Non-remote operators must offer customers ability to self-exclude from same gambling type across other local operators

key_requirements.detail: Licensees must offer customers ability to self-exclude from same kind of gambling offered in their locality by other holders of operating licences by participating in one or more available multi-operator self-exclusion schemes

subsections.subsection_title: Employment of children and young persons

provisions.provision_title: Employment of children and young persons - Bingo
applies_to: All non-remote bingo licences
provisions.provision_summary: Bingo operators should be aware of legal prohibitions on employing children and young persons in various capacities

key_requirements.detail: Licensees who employ children (under-16) and young persons (16-17) should be aware that it is an offence to: (a) employ them to provide bingo facilities, (b) require them to perform gaming machine functions, (c) employ child to perform any function on premises where/when bingo facilities being provided
Commission view: relevant provision applies to ANY function in connection with gaming machine, including servicing or cleaning

Have and put into effect policies and procedures to ensure: (a) children and young persons never asked to perform prohibited tasks, (b) all staff instructed about laws relating to children and young persons access to gambling
Consider adopting policy that: (a) children not employed on bingo premises when open for business, (b) neither children nor young persons asked to work in areas where gaming machines situated

provisions.provision_title: Employment of children and young persons - Remote
applies_to: All remote licences except lottery, pool betting, gaming machine technical, gambling software, ancillary remote bingo, ancillary remote casino, remote betting intermediary (trading room)
provisions.provision_summary: Remote operators should be aware of legal prohibition on employing children and young persons to provide gambling facilities

key_requirements.detail: Licensees who employ children (under-16) and young persons (16-17) should be aware that it is an offence to employ them to provide facilities for gambling

applies_to: All non-remote general betting licences (except casino premises), pool betting licences, and all remote licences (including ancillary remote betting) except gaming machine technical, gambling software, host, ancillary remote casino, ancillary remote bingo, remote betting intermediary (trading room)
provisions.provision_summary: Operators who offer credit must implement strict controls on credit checking, limits, and prohibited marketing to vulnerable persons

key_requirements.detail: Licensees who choose to offer credit to members of public who are not themselves gambling operators must also:

subsections.detail: Have procedures for checking and scoring applications for credit, for setting and for increasing credit limits
Explain these procedures to customers
Set maximum credit limit for each customer and not permit customers to exceed without further application
Apply 24-hour delay between receiving request for limit increase and granting where limit exceeds previously set level
Not require minimum spend within set time period
Take all reasonable steps to ensure credit offers not sent to vulnerable persons including those who have self-excluded
Ensure credit offers include risk warning of what may happen in event of default

applies_to: All non-remote casino licences
provisions.provision_summary: Casinos should take steps to prevent systematic or organized money lending between customers on premises

key_requirements.detail: Licensees should take steps to prevent systematic or organized money lending between customers on their premises

Nature of steps depends on premises layout/size but should cover: (a) systems for monitoring for such activity, (b) instructions to staff on what to do if they spot significant money lending and to managers on handling, (c) excluding from premises any person involved in organized/systematic money lending

Appropriate arrangements for cases where lending appears commercial in nature or may involve money laundering; if latter, follow suspicious transaction reporting requirements; in all cases where systematic/organized money lending encountered, make report to Commission

applies_to: All remote licences (including ancillary remote betting) except gaming machine technical, gambling software, host, ancillary remote bingo, ancillary remote casino, remote betting intermediary (trading room)
provisions.provision_summary: Remote operators must identify separate accounts held by same individual and apply limits on aggregate basis across all accounts

key_requirements.requirement: Identify multiple accounts by same individual
key_requirements.detail: Licensees must have and put into effect policies and procedures designed to identify separate accounts which are held by same individual

Where licensees allow customers to hold more than one account, must have procedures to relate each of customer's accounts to each other and ensure: (a) if customer opts to self-exclude effectively excluded from all gambling unless request relates only to some forms or some accounts, (b) all customer accounts monitored and CI decisions based on observed behaviour across all accounts, (c) where credit offered maximum limit applied on aggregate basis across all accounts, (d) individual financial limits can be implemented across all accounts

Companies/bodies corporate must take all reasonable steps to comply as if reference to customer holding more than one account with them included reference to customer holding one or more accounts with them and one or more accounts with group company
Group company = holding company, subsidiary, or shares common holding company with licensee per Companies Act 2006 or statutory modification

sections.section_overview: Requirements for segregation and protection of customer funds held by operators

applies_to: All operating licences except gaming machine technical, gambling software, host, ancillary remote bingo, ancillary remote casino
provisions.provision_summary: Operators should ensure customer funds are held separately and protected in event of insolvency

key_requirements.detail: Customer funds should be held in separate client bank accounts segregated from operator's own funds
key_requirements.compliance_action: Establish dedicated client segregated account(s); audit quarterly to verify segregation

key_requirements.detail: Keep accurate records of all customer funds held
key_requirements.compliance_action: Implement accounting systems tracking customer fund balances

sections.section_overview: Requirements for payment methods and handling of payments

applies_to: All operating licences except gaming machine technical, gambling software, host
provisions.provision_summary: Operators should implement policies on cash and cash equivalents to minimize money laundering risk

key_requirements.detail: Have policies and procedures concerning cash and cash equivalents (drafts, cheques, debit cards, digital currencies) to minimize money laundering risk, avoid illicit credit, and promote licensing objectives
key_requirements.compliance_action: Document detailed cash handling policies; communicate to all staff

key_requirements.detail: Policies must be implemented effectively, kept under review, revised appropriately to remain effective, and take account of Commission guidance
key_requirements.compliance_action: Conduct annual policy reviews; update based on regulatory changes

sections.section_overview: Requirements and prohibitions relating to credit provision

subsections.subsection_title: Credit provision and card use restrictions

provisions.provision_title: Credit prohibition - Adult Gaming Centres and Family Entertainment Centres
applies_to: All gaming machine general operating licences for adult gaming centres and family entertainment centres
provisions.provision_summary: AGC and FEC operators must not provide or facilitate credit in connection with gambling

key_requirements.detail: Licensee must not provide credit themselves in connection with gambling
key_requirements.compliance_action: Ensure payment systems cannot process credit transactions

key_requirements.detail: Licensee must not participate in, arrange, permit or knowingly facilitate giving of credit in connection with gambling
key_requirements.compliance_action: Monitor premises and staff to prevent informal credit arrangements

applies_to: All non-remote general betting, pool betting, betting intermediary licences, and all remote licences (including ancillary remote betting, ancillary remote lottery) except gaming machine technical, gambling software, host
provisions.provision_summary: Operators must not accept credit card payments for gambling

key_requirements.detail: Licensee must not accept payment for gambling by credit card, including credit card payments through money service business
key_requirements.compliance_action: Configure payment processors to block credit card transactions; communicate policy to customers

sections.section_overview: Requirements for fair and transparent terms and practices

applies_to: All operating licences except gaming machine technical, gambling software
provisions.provision_summary: Operators must ensure terms and practices are fair, transparent, and comply with consumer protection laws

key_requirements.detail: Terms and consumer notices must not be unfair under Consumer Rights Act 2015; licensee must comply with terms
key_requirements.compliance_action: Review all terms against CRA 2015 fairness test; obtain legal review

key_requirements.detail: Contractual terms and consumer notices must be transparent under CRA 2015 and readily accessible to customers
key_requirements.compliance_action: Use plain language; ensure easy online access; test readability

key_requirements.detail: Changes must comply with fairness/transparency requirements; material changes must be notified before effective date
key_requirements.compliance_action: Notify customers of material changes; obtain confirmation where required

key_requirements.detail: Must not commit unfair commercial practices under Consumer Protection from Unfair Trading Regulations 2008
key_requirements.compliance_action: Train staff on CMA guidance; monitor for unfair practices; document decisions

sections.section_overview: Requirements to display licensing information to customers

applies_to: All remote casino, bingo, betting licences except ancillary, host, remote betting intermediary (trading room), remote general betting (limited), remote general betting (remote platform)
provisions.provision_summary: Remote B2C operators must display licensing information on all customer-facing screens

key_requirements.detail: Must display on every screen from which customers can access gambling facilities
Must display: (a) statement that licensed and regulated by UKGC, (b) UKGC account number, (c) link to UKGC website showing current licensed status
Information in format specified by Commission in technical standards
May display other licences if clearly marked as relying on UKGC licence for GB provision

applies_to: All gaming machine technical, gambling software, host licences
provisions.provision_summary: B2B operators must display licensing information on website and product pages

key_requirements.detail: First page offering gaming machines or gambling software must display licensing information
At least minimal information on each page offering products in reliance on licence
If offering products not regulated by Commission, clearly distinguish UKGC-regulated products

sections.section_overview: Requirements regarding permitted games and game rules

applies_to: All non-remote casino operating licences
provisions.provision_summary: Casinos must follow Commission rules on permitted games but are generally free to offer new games

key_requirements.detail: Must not offer or permit prohibited casino games per Commission published list
Casino businesses free to offer new casino games and variants without Commission approval

sections.section_overview: Requirements for tipping arrangements in casinos

applies_to: All non-remote casino operating licences
provisions.provision_summary: Casino tips must be managed through tronc system for fair distribution

key_requirements.detail: Tips permitted only through tronc system where all tips pooled and distributed amongst employees
Separate tronc may operate for each category of licensed staff

sections.section_overview: Requirements for lottery operations by societies and external lottery managers

provisions.provision_title: Society and local authority lottery requirements
applies_to: All lottery operating licences issued to non-commercial societies or local authorities
provisions.provision_summary: Society and LA lotteries must meet minimum proceeds requirements, limits, and accounting standards

key_requirements.detail: At least 20% of lottery proceeds must be applied to society's purpose or LA's statutory power
Single lottery max proceeds £5,000,000; aggregate annual proceeds max £50,000,000
Individual ticket maximum win: £25,000 or 10% of proceeds (whichever greater)
Cannot link to other lotteries unless max aggregate win under £500,000
Each ticket must identify: promoting society, designated member name/address, draw date(s), 'licensed by Gambling Commission', Commission website
Ticket price must be: uniform, shown on ticket, paid before issue
Lodge description and rules with Commission at least 28 days before sale
Cannot sell in street except from static structures (kiosk) or door-to-door (requires local authority permission)
Records must show: total proceeds, prize allocation, expenses, amount to purpose, sold/unsold ticket count
Within 3 months of draw, submit lottery submission with accounting and qualified person approval
If annual proceeds exceed £1,000,000, provide auditor confirmation proceeds fully accounted for

applies_to: All lottery operating licences issued to external lottery managers
provisions.provision_summary: ELMs must ensure minimum proceeds to society, segregate funds in trustee accounts, and maintain proper accounting

key_requirements.detail: At least 20% of proceeds paid to promoting society/LA for qualifying purpose
Single lottery max £5,000,000; aggregate per society/LA max £50,000,000
Individual maximum: £25,000 or 10% of proceeds
Lottery proceeds segregated from trading income; held in trustee bank account for each society/LA; protected in event of ELM insolvency
Procedures to ensure lottery profits properly allocated and accounted to society/LA promptly
All other society lottery requirements apply (non-linked, documentation, street sales restrictions, accounting, submission, auditor confirmation)

applies_to: All pool betting licences

key_requirements.detail: Implement fair and transparent procedures for pool operation
Provide clear information to customers about how pools operate and odds calculation

sections.section_overview: Requirements for managing access to gambling premises

applies_to: All non-remote casino, bingo, betting, adult gaming centre licences
provisions.provision_summary: Operators should maintain effective supervision and access procedures

Implement procedures controlling access to gambling areas, particularly age-restricted areas

Submit required returns and reports to Commission within specified deadlines
Retain records for minimum periods specified by Commission guidance

key_principles: Social Responsibility Code provisions are mandatory conditions of licence

Commission expects cooperative engagement and proactive disclosure of material information
Breaches of SR Code may result in financial penalties; breaches of Ordinary Code cannot
implementation_approach: Establish documented policies and procedures for each applicable provision
Provide staff training and ensure understanding of requirements
Maintain records and audit trails for compliance
Regularly review and update policies to remain current with regulatory changes
Engage proactively with Commission on compliance queries
